intro: Synaphea oligantha, commonly known as the slender synaphea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are simple and ovate, often covered in fine hairs. Synaphea oligantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
